text: Fintan Monahan KC*HS (born 23 January 1967) is the Roman Catholic Bishop of Killaloe, who previously served as a priest in the Tuam Diocese and worked as a teacher in St. Jarlath's College, Galway. Monahan was born in Tullamore, Co. Offaly, in 1967 to Tom and Peg Monahan and he has one brother and one sister.Tuams Fintan Monahan appointed Bishop of Killaloe Connacht Tribune, 29 July 2016. He began studies for the priesthood at Maynooth College in 1984. He completed a B.Sc. (NUI) in 1987, a B.D. (Maynooth Pontifical University) in 1990, an S.T.L. in Biblical Theology in 1992 and a H.Dip. in Education (NUI Galway) in 1993. Monahan was ordained to the priesthood in 1991 and served as a curate in Conamara, County Galway, before beginning a teaching and chaplaincy post at St. Jarlath's College, Tuam, Co. Galway.Pope Francis appoints Father Fintan Monahan as Bishop of Killaloe www.catholicbishops.ie, 29 July 2016. Whilst at St. Jarlath's College he taught science, religion and Irish in addition to coaching basketball and hurling. He also served as Secretary of the Tuam Diocese. The Holy See announced Fr. Monahan's appointment as Bishop of Killaloe in July 2016 and he was consecrated in Ennis Cathedral on 25 September 2016. www.catholicbishops.ie, 29 July 2016 ==References== Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Alumni of NUI Galway Category:Alumni of St Patrick's College, Maynooth Category:Irish Roman Catholic bishops Category:People from Tullamore, County Offaly Category:Post-Reformation Roman Catholic bishops in Ireland Category:Roman Catholic bishops of Killaloe
title: Fintan Monahan
